intro: Preptanthe papuana, commonly known as the Papuan preptanthe, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
